00063 static u32* msgbuf_in_physaddr  = ((u32 *) na_MSGiBuffer_base);
00064 static u32* msgbuf_out_physaddr = ((u32 *) na_MSGoBuffer_base);
00065 static u32* regfile_physaddr    = ((u32 *) na_RegFile_base);
00066 static int dcsc_msgbuf_in_size   = na_MSGiBuffer_size;
00067 static int dcsc_msgbuf_out_size  = na_MSGoBuffer_size;

00069 #else //INCLUDE_EXCALIBUR_H
00070 // the default values can be changed at driver load time

00072 static int dcsc_msgbuf_out_size  = 0x400;
00073 static int dcsc_regfile_size     = 0x10;
00074 static u32* msgbuf_in_physaddr  = ((u32 *) 0x80000400);
00075 static u32* msgbuf_out_physaddr = ((u32 *) 0x80000800);
00076 static u32* regfile_physaddr    = ((u32 *) 0x80000060);
00077 #endif //INCLUDE_EXCALIBUR_H

00087 MODULE_PARM(dcsc_majorID, "i");            // the major id for the installation of the driver
00088 MODULE_PARM(dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, "i");     // size of the MIB in byte
00089 MODULE_PARM(dcsc_msgbuf_out_size, "i");    // size of the MRB in byte
00090 MODULE_PARM(dcsc_regfile_size, "i");       // size of the REG buffer in byte
00091 MODULE_PARM(msgbuf_in_physaddr, "i");      // physical address of the MIB in FPGA firmware
00092 MODULE_PARM(msgbuf_out_physaddr, "i");     // physical address of the MRB in FPGA firmware
00093 MODULE_PARM(regfile_physaddr, "i");        // physical address of the REG buffer in FPGA firmware

00096 /*
00097  * access modes not yet used
00098  * in ACCESS_ALL mode the driver is forseen to export the 3 buffers sequentially after each other
00099  * MIB -> MRB -> REG
00100  * other modes are intended to support separated access via different minor driver numbers
00101  */
00102 static int iAccessMode=ACCESS_ALL;

00108 /**************************************************************************************************
00109  * some helper functions to check the address space
00110  */
00111 // very basic MEMTEST
00112 // size in u8, test in u32
00113 static int memtest(u32 begin, u32 size) {
00114   u32 i,rd;
00115   int ret=0;
00116   int success=0;
00117   for (i=0;i<size;i+=4) {
00118     writel(i+1, begin + i);
00119   }
00120 
00121   for (i=0;i<size;i+=4) {
00122     rd=readl(begin + i);
00123     if (  rd != i+1 ) {
00124       //mrlogmessage(LOG_SELFTEST|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "Read fail @ 0x%08X: read 0x%08X, expected 0x%08X",begin+i,rd,i);
00125       ret++;
00126     } else {
00127       success++;
00128       //mrlogmessage(LOG_SELFTEST|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Read succeeded @ 0x%08X: read 0x%08X, expected 0x%08X",begin+i,rd,i+1);
00129     }
00130   }
00131   //mrlogmessage(LOG_SELFTEST|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG " %d read cycles succeeded", success);
00132   return ret;
00133 }
00134 
00135 static int dcs_comparevalue(u32 begin, u32 size, u32 value) {
00136   u32 i,rd;
00137   int ret=0;
00138   for (i=0;i<size;i+=4) {
00139     rd=readl(begin + i);
00140     if (rd != value ) {
00141       //mrlogmessage(LOG_SELFTEST|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING " compare failed @ 0x%08X: read 0x%08X, expected 0x%08X",begin+i,rd,value);
00142       ret++;
00143     } else {
00144       //mrlogmessage(LOG_SELFTEST|LOG_DBG, KERN_INFO " compare succeeded @ 0x%08X: read 0x%08X, expected 0x%08X",begin+i,rd,value);
00145     }
00146   }
00147   return ret;
00148 }
00149 
00150 static int dcs_writevalue (u32 begin, u32 size, u32 value) {
00151    int i;
00152    u32 offs=0;
00153    for (i=0;i<size;i+=4){
00154      writel(value,begin+i);
00155      offs++;
00156    }
00157    return 0;
00158 }
00159 
00160 /**************************************************************************************************
00161  * basic internal functions
00162  */
00163 
00164 /* read from memory
00165  * the readl and readb functions are provided by the system and must be used to read from 
00166  * io memory initialized by ioremap (see init_module)
00167  * parameters:
00168  *  begin: start address
00169  *  size:  size of the buffer in BYTE
00170  *  buff:  pointer to buffer that receives data
00171  */
00172 static int dcs_read (u32 begin, u32 size, u32* buff) 
00173 {
00174   int i;
00175   u32 wordoffs=0;
00176   for (i=0;i<size/4;i++){ // do the multiples of 4 
00177     *(buff+wordoffs) = readl(begin+i*4);
00178     wordoffs++;    
00179   }
00180   i*=4;
00181   u32 byteoffs=0; 
00182   for (;i<size;i++) { // do the remaining bytes
00183     *(((char*)(buff+wordoffs))+byteoffs)=readb(begin+i);
00184     byteoffs++;
00185   }
00186   return 0;
00187 }
00188 
00189 /* write to memory
00190  * the writel and writeb functions are provided by the system and must be used to write to 
00191  * io memory initialized by ioremap (see init_module)
00192  * parameters:
00193  *  begin: start address
00194  *  size:  size of the buffer in BYTE
00195  *  buff:  pointer to buffer to write
00196  */
00197 static int dcs_write (u32 begin, u32 size, u32* buff) 
00198 {
00199   int i;
00200   u32 wordoffs=0;
00201   for (i=0;i<size/4;i++){// do the multibles of 4
00202     writel(*(buff+wordoffs),begin+i*4);
00203     wordoffs++;
00204   }
00205   i*=4;
00206   u32 byteoffs=0; 
00207   for (;i<size;i++) { // do the remaining bytes
00208     writeb(*(((char*)(buff+wordoffs))+byteoffs), begin+i);
00209     byteoffs++;
00210   }
00211   return 0;
00212 }
00213 
00214 /* find the buffer for the access region 
00215 the access region appears to the user as a solid block containing the write buffer of dcsc_msgbuf_in_size bytes, 
00216 followed by the read message buffer of dcsc_msgbuf_out_size and the register buffer of dcsc_regfile_size bytes
00217 parameter: size of the buffer, <0 in case of an error
00218  offset       - position in the access region
00219  iAccessMode  - access mode, see defines
00220 return: 
00221  ppBuffer     - receives pointer to buffer
00222  pPosition    - receives position in the buffer
00223  ppBufferName - receives string describing the buffer
00224  */
00225 u32 findBufferForAddress(loff_t offset, int iAccessMode,  u32** ppBuffer, u32* pPosition, const char** ppBufferName)
00226 {
00227   u32 u32Size=0, u32Pos=0;
00228   u32* pu32Buffer=NULL;
00229   const char* pBufferName="";
00230   if (offset < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size) {
00231     if (iAccessMode&ACCESS_IN_BUFFER /*|| iAccessMode==ACCESS_REGIONS*/) {
00232       u32Pos=offset;
00233       pu32Buffer=msgbuf_in_virtbase;
00234       u32Size=dcsc_msgbuf_in_size;
00235       pBufferName="write msg buffer";
00236     } else {
00237       //mrlogmessage(LOG_FLAG_ALL, KERN_WARNING "");
00238       u32Size=-EFAULT;
00239     }
00240   } else if (offset >= dcsc_msgbuf_in_size && offset < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size+dcsc_msgbuf_out_size) {
00241     if (iAccessMode&ACCESS_OUT_BUFFER /*|| iAccessMode==ACCESS_REGIONS*/) {
00242       u32Pos=offset-dcsc_msgbuf_in_size;
00243       pu32Buffer=msgbuf_out_virtbase;
00244       u32Size=dcsc_msgbuf_out_size;
00245       pBufferName="read msg buffer";
00246     } else {
00247       //mrlogmessage(LOG_FLAG_ALL, KERN_WARNING "");
00248       u32Size=-EFAULT;
00249     }
00250   } else if (offset >= dcsc_msgbuf_in_size + dcsc_msgbuf_out_size && offset < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size + dcsc_msgbuf_out_size + dcsc_regfile_size) {
00251     if (iAccessMode&ACCESS_REGFILE /*|| iAccessMode==ACCESS_REGIONS*/) {
00252       u32Pos=offset - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size - dcsc_msgbuf_out_size;
00253       pu32Buffer=regfile_virtbase;
00254       u32Size=dcsc_regfile_size;
00255       pBufferName="register buffer";
00256     } else {
00257       //mrlogmessage(LOG_FLAG_ALL, KERN_WARNING "");
00258       u32Size=-EFAULT;
00259     }
00260   } else
00261     u32Size=-ESPIPE;
00262   if (u32Size>=0) {
00263     if (u32Size<=u32Pos)
00264       u32Size-=u32Pos;
00265     else
00266       mrlogmessage(LOG_FLAG_ALL, KERN_ERR "buffer position exceeds buffer size");
00267     if (ppBuffer) *ppBuffer=pu32Buffer;
00268     if (pPosition) *pPosition=u32Pos;
00269     else if (ppBuffer) mrlogmessage(LOG_FLAG_ALL, KERN_WARNING "return variable missing for position in buffer, check your call");
00270     if (ppBufferName) *ppBufferName=pBufferName;
00271   }
00272   return u32Size;
00273 }

00275 /******************************************************************************************************
00276  * driver lock
00277  */
00278 
00279 /* global variables
00280  */
00281 wait_queue_head_t g_waitQueue;  // the wait queue for the concurrenting processes
00282 int g_iLockReset=0;             // an emergency back door, all released processes terminate lockDriver()
00283 int g_iLock=0;                  // the lock itself
00284 int g_iLockPid=0;               // the pid of the locking process
00285 int g_iSeizeCode=0;            // the master lock code
00286 spinlock_t g_spinlock;
00287 int g_iLockInitialized=0;
00288 
00289 int InitDriverLock()
00290 {
00291   int iResult=0;
00292   init_waitqueue_head(&g_waitQueue);
00293   spin_lock_init(&g_spinlock);
00294   g_iLockReset=0;
00295   g_iLock=0;
00296   g_iLockPid=0;
00297   g_iSeizeCode=0;
00298   g_iLockInitialized=1;
00299   return iResult;
00300 }
00301 
00302 int lockActivate()
00303 {
00304   int iResult=0;
00305   g_iLockReset=0;
00306   return iResult;
00307 }
00308 
00309 int lockReset()
00310 {
00311   int iResult=0;
00312   g_iLockReset=1; // set the flag so that the processes do not try to lock again
00313   g_iLock=0;
00314   g_iLockPid=0;
00315   g_iSeizeCode=0;
00316   if (g_iLockInitialized) {
00317     wake_up(&g_waitQueue); // wake up all processes
00318   }
00319   return iResult;
00320 }
00321 
00334 int checkAndLock(int iSeizeCode, int pid)
00335 {
00336   int iResult=0;
00337   if (g_iLockInitialized) {
00338     //mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "checkAndLock: process %d, iSeizeCode %d, g_iSeizeCode %d", pid, iSeizeCode, g_iSeizeCode);    
00339     spin_lock(&g_spinlock);
00340     if (g_iSeizeCode>0 && g_iSeizeCode!=iSeizeCode) {
00341       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "checkAndLock: driver seized by other application");    
00342       iResult=-EPERM;
00343     } else if ((iResult=(g_iLock==0))) {
00344       g_iLock++;
00345       g_iLockPid=pid;
00346     } else if ((iResult=(g_iLockPid==pid))) {
00347       g_iLock++;
00348     }
00349     spin_unlock(&g_spinlock);
00350   }
00351   return iResult;
00352 }
00353 
00363 int lockDriver(int iSeizeCode, int iTimeOut)
00364 {
00365   int iResult=0;
00366   if (g_iLockInitialized) {
00367     int iPid=0;
00368     if (current) iPid=current->pid;
00369     while (g_iLockReset==0 && (iResult=checkAndLock(iSeizeCode, iPid))==0) {
00370       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "lockDriver: process %d, timeout %d put to sleep", iPid, iTimeOut);
00371       interruptible_sleep_on(&g_waitQueue);
00372       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "lockDriver: process %d woken up", iPid);
00373     }
00374     if (iResult>=0) {
00375       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "lockDriver: process %d", iPid);
00376     }
00377   }
00378   return iResult;
00379 }
00380 
00389 int seizeDriver(int iSeizeCode)
00390 {
00391   int iResult=0;
00392   if ((iResult=lockDriver(iSeizeCode, 0))>=0) {
00393     if (g_iSeizeCode==0) {
00394       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "driver seized by process %d", current->pid);
00395       g_iSeizeCode=iSeizeCode;
00396     } else if (g_iSeizeCode==iSeizeCode) {
00397       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "driver already seized by application %d", current->pid);
00398     } else {
00399       // we should never get here
00400       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "driver already seized by another application", current->pid);
00401     }
00402     unlockDriver();
00403   }
00404   return iResult;
00405 }
00406 
00410 int unlockDriver()
00411 {
00412   int iResult=0;
00413   if (g_iLockInitialized) {
00414     int iPid=0;
00415     if (current) iPid=current->pid;
00416     mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "unlockDriver: process %d", iPid);
00417     spin_lock(&g_spinlock);
00418     if (g_iLockPid==iPid) {
00419       if ((--g_iLock)==0) {
00420     g_iLockPid=0;
00421     wake_up(&g_waitQueue); // wake up all processes
00422       } else if (g_iLock<0) {
00423     g_iLock=0;
00424     mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "underflow while unlocking for process %d", iPid);
00425       }
00426     } else {
00427       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "process %d has no lock on driver", iPid);
00428       iResult=-ENOLCK;
00429     }
00430     spin_unlock(&g_spinlock);
00431   }
00432   return iResult;
00433 }
00434 
00441 int releaseDriver(int iSeizeCode)
00442 {
00443   int iResult=0;
00444   if ((iResult=lockDriver(iSeizeCode, 0))>=0) {
00445     if (g_iSeizeCode==0) {
00446       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "driver not seized by process %d", current->pid);
00447       iResult=-ENOLCK;
00448     } else if (g_iSeizeCode==iSeizeCode) {
00449       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "seized driver released by application %d", current->pid);
00450       g_iSeizeCode=0;
00451     } else {
00452       // we should never get here
00453       mrlogmessage(LOG_DRIVER_LCK|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "driver is seized by another application", current->pid);
00454     }
00455     unlockDriver();
00456   }
00457   return iResult;
00458 }

00467 static loff_t dcsc_llseek(struct file* filp, loff_t off, int ref);
00468 static int dcsc_read(struct file* filp, char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* f_pos);
00469 static int dcsc_write(struct file* filp, const char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* f_pos);
00470 static int dcsc_open(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp);
00471 static int dcsc_close(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp);
00472 static int dcsc_mmap(struct file *filp, struct vm_area_struct *vma);
00473 static int dcsc_ioctl(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp, unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg);
00474 
00475 /*
00476  * file_operation structure to define the methods for the char device
00477  * the methods are going to be called from the system
00478  * pointers to the methods are provided at driver initialization via the file_operations structure
00479  */
00480 struct file_operations dcsc_fops = {
00481   llseek:  dcsc_llseek,
00482   read:    dcsc_read,
00483   write:   dcsc_write,
00484   ioctl:   dcsc_ioctl,
00485   mmap:    dcsc_mmap,
00486   open:    dcsc_open,
00487   release: dcsc_close,
00488 };
00489 
00490 #ifndef DCSC_TEST
00491 /*
00492  * cleanup of the buffers for the real driver
00493  */
00494 void cleanupRealBuffers()
00495 {
00496   if (regfile_virtbase) iounmap((void *)regfile_virtbase);
00497   if (msgbuf_out_virtbase) iounmap((void *)msgbuf_out_virtbase);
00498   if (msgbuf_in_virtbase) iounmap((void *)msgbuf_in_virtbase);
00499 }
00500 
00501 /*
00502  * initialization of the buffers for the real driver
00503  */
00504 #define TEST_PATTERN 0x13071972
00505 int initRealBuffers()
00506 {
00507   int iResult=0;
00508   int iNofErr=0;
00509   if (dcsc_msgbuf_in_size>0) {
00510     msgbuf_in_virtbase  = (u32*) ioremap_nocache((u32)msgbuf_in_physaddr,dcsc_msgbuf_in_size);
00511     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Remapped MSGBUF_IN from 0x%p to 0x%p",msgbuf_in_physaddr, msgbuf_in_virtbase);
00512   }
00513   if (dcsc_msgbuf_out_size>0) {
00514     msgbuf_out_virtbase = (u32*) ioremap_nocache((u32)msgbuf_out_physaddr,dcsc_msgbuf_out_size);
00515     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Remapped MSGBUF_OUT from 0x%p to 0x%p",msgbuf_out_physaddr, msgbuf_out_virtbase);
00516   }
00517   if (dcsc_regfile_size) {
00518     regfile_virtbase    = (u32*) ioremap_nocache((u32)regfile_physaddr,dcsc_regfile_size);
00519     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Remapped REGFILE from 0x%p to 0x%p",regfile_physaddr, regfile_virtbase);
00520   }
00521   if (regfile_virtbase && msgbuf_in_virtbase && msgbuf_out_virtbase){
00522 
00523     // test the MIB, the MRB is readonly and can not be tested
00524     writel(0x40, regfile_virtbase); // set bit 6 in the control register which enables the MIB to be read/write
00525     iNofErr=memtest((u32) msgbuf_in_virtbase , dcsc_msgbuf_in_size);
00526     if (iNofErr==0) {
00527       //mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "first test succeeded - buffer size = %d errors = %d", dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, iNofErr);
00528       dcs_writevalue((u32)msgbuf_in_virtbase, dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, TEST_PATTERN);
00529       if ((iNofErr=dcs_comparevalue((u32)msgbuf_in_virtbase, dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, TEST_PATTERN))==0) {
00530     writel(0x00, regfile_virtbase); // now set the buffer to write only
00531     iNofErr=dcs_comparevalue((u32)msgbuf_in_virtbase, dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, TEST_PATTERN);
00532 
00533     if (iNofErr==dcsc_msgbuf_in_size) { // the test should fail now
00534       iNofErr=0;
00535     } else {
00536       mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "some of the locations are still read/writeable, but the buffer is supposed to be write only ");
00537       if (iNofErr>0)
00538         iNofErr=0;
00539     }
00540       } else {
00541     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "second test of MIB failed - buffer size = %d errors = %d", dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, iNofErr);
00542       }
00543     } else {
00544       mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "first test of MIB failed - buffer size = %d errors = %d", dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, iNofErr);
00545     }
00546     if (iNofErr>0) {
00547       mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "memtest finished with %d error(s), eventually check your parameters", iNofErr);
00548       iResult=-EIO;
00549     } else {
00550       mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "message buffer found and tested(test pattern 0x%x)", TEST_PATTERN);
00551     }
00552   } else if ((regfile_virtbase==NULL && dcsc_regfile_size>0) ||
00553          (msgbuf_in_virtbase==NULL && dcsc_msgbuf_in_size>0) ||
00554          (msgbuf_out_virtbase==NULL && dcsc_msgbuf_out_size>0) 
00555          ){
00556     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "can not remap hardware resources");
00557     iResult=-EIO;
00558   }
00559   if (iResult<0) {
00560     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "can not initialize memory areas");
00561     cleanupRealBuffers();
00562   }
00563   return iResult;
00564 }
00565 
00566 #else //DCSC_TEST
00567 /*
00568  * cleanup of the buffers for the simulated driver
00569  */
00570 void cleanupSimulatedBuffers()
00571 {
00572   if (msgbuf_in_virtbase) kfree(msgbuf_in_virtbase);
00573   if (msgbuf_out_virtbase) kfree(msgbuf_out_virtbase);
00574   if (regfile_virtbase) kfree(regfile_virtbase);
00575 }
00576 
00577 /*
00578  * initialization of the buffers for the simulated driver
00579  */
00580 int initSimulatedBuffers()
00581 {
00582   int iResult=0;
00583   int iNofErr=0;
00584   mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "this is a test version");
00585   if (dcsc_msgbuf_in_size>0)
00586     msgbuf_in_virtbase  = (u32*) kmalloc(dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, GFP_KERNEL);
00587   if (dcsc_msgbuf_out_size>0)
00588     msgbuf_out_virtbase = (u32*) kmalloc(dcsc_msgbuf_out_size, GFP_KERNEL);
00589   if (dcsc_regfile_size)
00590     regfile_virtbase    = (u32*) kmalloc(dcsc_regfile_size, GFP_KERNEL);
00591   if (msgbuf_in_virtbase) mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Allocated MIB at 0x%p %d bytes", msgbuf_in_virtbase, dcsc_msgbuf_in_size);
00592   if (msgbuf_out_virtbase) mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Allocated MRB at 0x%p %d bytes", msgbuf_out_virtbase, dcsc_msgbuf_out_size);
00593   if (regfile_virtbase) mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Allocated REG at 0x%p %d bytes", regfile_virtbase, dcsc_regfile_size);
00594   if (msgbuf_in_virtbase){
00595     iNofErr=memtest( (u32) msgbuf_in_virtbase , dcsc_msgbuf_in_size);
00596     dcs_writevalue((u32)msgbuf_in_virtbase , dcsc_msgbuf_in_size, 0);
00597     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Test MIB: %d errors",iNofErr);
00598   } else {
00599     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "Allocation of MIB failed");
00600   }
00601 
00602   if (msgbuf_out_virtbase){
00603     iNofErr=memtest( (u32) msgbuf_out_virtbase , dcsc_msgbuf_out_size);
00604     dcs_writevalue((u32)msgbuf_out_virtbase , dcsc_msgbuf_out_size, 0);
00605     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Test MRB: %d errors",iNofErr);
00606   } else {
00607     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "Allocation of MRB failed");
00608   }
00609 
00610   if (regfile_virtbase){
00611     iNofErr=memtest( (u32) regfile_virtbase , dcsc_regfile_size);
00612     dcs_writevalue((u32)regfile_virtbase , dcsc_regfile_size, 0);
00613     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "Test REG: %d errors",iNofErr);
00614   } else {
00615     mrlogmessage(LOG_INTERNAL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "Allocation of REG failed");
00616   }
00617   return iResult;
00618 }
00619 #endif //DCSC_TEST
00620 
00621 /*
00622  * init_module called from the system during insmod command
00623  */
00624 int init_module(void) {
00625   // TODO check for stuff to cleanup in case of error and undesired termination
00626   int iResult=0;
00627 
00628   // originally the driver sizes of the buffers were checked at driver load. This
00629   // has been removed here in order to have a multi-purpose driver which allows
00630   // access to arbitrary 3 buffers.
00631   // The buffer sizes are check in the dcscMsgBufferInterface anyway.
00632 
00633   // register the driver
00634   iResult = register_chrdev(dcsc_majorID, "dcsc", &dcsc_fops);
00635   if (iResult < 0) {
00636     mrlogmessage(LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "module init: can't register driver");
00637   } else {
00638     mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "Module init (compiled "__DATE__", "__TIME__") version %d.%d - %s", DRIVER_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER, DRIVER_MINOR_VERSION_NUMBER, RELEASETYPE);
00639     if (dcsc_majorID == 0) { /* dynamic allocation of major number*/
00640       dcsc_majorID = iResult; 
00641       mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "dynamic allocation of major number: %d", dcsc_majorID);
00642     } else {
00643       mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "register dcscard driver at major no. %d", dcsc_majorID);
00644     }
00645 #ifndef DCSC_TEST
00646     iResult=initRealBuffers();
00647 #else 
00648     iResult=initSimulatedBuffers();
00649 #endif //DCSC_TEST
00650     InitDriverLock();
00651   }
00652 
00653   return iResult;
00654 }
00655 
00656 /*
00657  * init_module called from the system during rmmod command
00658  */
00659 void cleanup_module(void) { 
00660   mrlogmessage(LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "Module exit");
00661 
00662 #ifndef DCSC_TEST
00663   cleanupRealBuffers();
00664 #else //DCSC_TEST
00665   cleanupSimulatedBuffers();
00666 #endif //DCSC_TEST
00667 
00668   unregister_chrdev(dcsc_majorID, "dcsc");
00669 }
00670 
00671 /******************************************************************************************************
00672  * implementation of driver access methods defined above
00673  */
00674 
00675 static loff_t dcsc_llseek(struct file* filp, loff_t off, int ref)
00676 {
00677   loff_t lPosition=0;
00678   if (filp){
00679     // by now the ref parameter is ignored, seek always from beginning
00680     lPosition=off;
00681     mrlogmessage(LOG_LLSEEK|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "llseek: position=%lld, offset=%lld, new position=%lld", filp->f_pos, off, lPosition);
00682   } else {
00683     mrlogmessage(LOG_LLSEEK|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "llseek: invalid file pointer");
00684     lPosition=-EFAULT;
00685   }
00686   if (lPosition>=0) filp->f_pos=lPosition;
00687   return lPosition;
00688 }
00689 
00690 static int dcsc_read(struct file* filp, char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* f_pos)
00691 {
00692   int iResult=0;
00693   if (filp==NULL) {
00694     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "read: invalid file pointer");
00695     return -EFAULT;
00696   }
00697   const char* pBufferName="<not specified name>";
00698   u32 lPos=filp->f_pos;
00699   u32 u32Offset=0;
00700   u32 u32Count=0;
00701   u32* pu32Source=NULL;
00702   if (filp && buf && count>=0 && lPos>=0){
00703     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "read: count=%d f_pos=0x%08x", count, lPos);
00704     if (iAccessMode==ACCESS_ALL) {
00705       if (lPos < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size) {
00706     if (count + lPos <= dcsc_msgbuf_in_size) {
00707       u32Count=count;
00708     } else {
00709       u32Count=dcsc_msgbuf_in_size;
00710       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "read: read access exceeds size of msg_in buffer, truncate");
00711     }
00712     u32Offset=lPos;
00713     pu32Source=msgbuf_in_virtbase;
00714     pBufferName="write msg buffer";
00715       } else if (lPos >= dcsc_msgbuf_in_size && lPos < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size+dcsc_msgbuf_out_size) {
00716     if (count + lPos - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size <= dcsc_msgbuf_out_size) {
00717       u32Count=count;
00718     } else {
00719       u32Count=dcsc_msgbuf_out_size;
00720       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "read: read access exceeds size of msg_out buffer, truncate");
00721     }
00722     u32Offset=lPos - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size;
00723     pu32Source=msgbuf_out_virtbase;
00724     pBufferName="read msg buffer";
00725       } else if (lPos >= dcsc_msgbuf_in_size + dcsc_msgbuf_out_size && lPos < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size + dcsc_msgbuf_out_size + dcsc_regfile_size) {
00726     if (count + lPos - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size - dcsc_msgbuf_out_size <= dcsc_regfile_size) {
00727       u32Count=count;
00728     } else {
00729       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "read: read access exceeds size of register buffer, read maximum");
00730       u32Count=dcsc_regfile_size;
00731     }
00732     u32Offset=lPos - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size - dcsc_msgbuf_out_size;
00733     pu32Source=regfile_virtbase;
00734     pBufferName="register buffer";
00735       }
00736     } else {
00737       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "read: access mode not yet implemented");
00738     }
00739     if (pu32Source!=NULL) {
00740       // to be deleted u32Offset*=sizeof(size_t);
00741       u32Offset/=sizeof(u32);
00742       pu32Source+=u32Offset;
00743       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "read: reading %d byte(s) from %s at 0x%8p to buffer 0x%8p", u32Count, pBufferName, pu32Source, buf);
00744       dcs_read((u32)pu32Source, u32Count, (u32*)buf);
00745       iResult=(int)u32Count;
00746       if (f_pos) *f_pos=filp->f_pos+iResult;
00747       else mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "read: invalid parameter f_pos, skipping position increment");
00748     } else {
00749       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "read: read access denied");
00750       iResult=-EFAULT;
00751     }
00752   } else {
00753     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "read: invalid parameter");
00754     iResult=-EINVAL;
00755   }
00756   return iResult;
00757 }
00758 
00759 static int dcsc_write(struct file* filp, const char* buf, size_t count, loff_t* f_pos)
00760 {
00761   int iResult=0;
00762   if (filp==NULL) {
00763     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "write: invalid file pointer");
00764     return -EFAULT;
00765   }
00766   const char* pBufferName="<not specified name>";
00767   u32 lPos=filp->f_pos;
00768   u32 u32Offset=0;
00769   u32 u32Count=0;
00770   u32* pu32Target=NULL;
00771   if (filp && buf && count>=0 && lPos>=0){
00772     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "write: count=%d f_pos=0x%08x", count, lPos);
00773     if (iAccessMode==ACCESS_ALL) {
00774       if (lPos < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size) {
00775     if (count + lPos <= dcsc_msgbuf_in_size) {
00776       u32Offset=lPos;
00777       u32Count=count;
00778       pu32Target=msgbuf_in_virtbase;
00779       pBufferName="write msg buffer";
00780     } else {
00781       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "write: write access exceeds size of msg_in buffer");
00782     }
00783       } else if (lPos >= dcsc_msgbuf_in_size && lPos < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size+dcsc_msgbuf_out_size) {
00784     if (count + lPos - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size <= dcsc_msgbuf_out_size) {
00785       u32Offset=lPos - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size;
00786       u32Count=count;
00787       pu32Target=msgbuf_out_virtbase;
00788       pBufferName="read msg buffer";
00789     } else {
00790       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "write: write access exceeds size of msg_out buffer");
00791     }
00792       } else if (lPos >= dcsc_msgbuf_in_size + dcsc_msgbuf_out_size && lPos < dcsc_msgbuf_in_size + dcsc_msgbuf_out_size + dcsc_regfile_size) {
00793     if (count + lPos - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size - dcsc_msgbuf_out_size <= dcsc_regfile_size) {
00794       u32Offset=lPos - dcsc_msgbuf_in_size - dcsc_msgbuf_out_size;
00795       u32Count=count;
00796       pu32Target=regfile_virtbase;
00797       pBufferName="register buffer";
00798     } else {
00799       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "write: write access exceeds size of register buffer");
00800     }
00801       }
00802     } else {
00803       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "write: access mode not yet implemented");
00804     }
00805     if (pu32Target!=NULL) {
00806       // to be deleted u32Offset*=sizeof(size_t);
00807       u32Offset/=sizeof(u32);
00808       pu32Target+=u32Offset;
00809       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "write: writing %d byte(s) from buffer 0x%8p to %s at 0x%8p", u32Count, (u32*)buf, pBufferName, pu32Target);
00810       dcs_write((u32)pu32Target, u32Count, (u32*)buf);
00811       iResult=(int)u32Count;
00812       if (f_pos) *f_pos=filp->f_pos+iResult;
00813       else mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "write: invalid parameter f_pos, skipping position increment");
00814     } else {
00815       mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "write: write access denied");
00816     iResult=-EFAULT;
00817     }
00818   } else {
00819     mrlogmessage(LOG_READ_WRITE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "write: invalid parameter");
00820     iResult=-EINVAL;
00821   }
00822   return iResult;
00823 }
00824 
00825 static int dcsc_open(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp)
00826 {
00827   int iResult=0;
00828   if ((regfile_virtbase==NULL && dcsc_regfile_size>0) ||
00829       (msgbuf_in_virtbase==NULL && dcsc_msgbuf_in_size>0) ||
00830       (msgbuf_out_virtbase==NULL && dcsc_msgbuf_out_size>0) 
00831       ){
00832     mrlogmessage(LOG_OPEN_CLOSE|LOG_ERROR, KERN_CRIT "open: panic, some base addresses not initialized");
00833     iResult=-EFAULT;
00834   } else {
00835     mrlogmessage(LOG_OPEN_CLOSE|LOG_INFO, MR_KERN_DEBUG "open");
00836   }
00837   return iResult;
00838 }
00839 
00840 static int dcsc_close(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp)
00841 {
00842   int iResult=0;
00843   mrlogmessage(LOG_OPEN_CLOSE|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "close");
00844   return iResult;
00845 }
00846 
00847 static int dcsc_mmap(struct file* filp, struct vm_area_struct* vma)
00848 {
00849   int iResult=0;
00850   mrlogmessage(LOG_MMAP|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "mmap: not yet implemented");
00851   return iResult;
00852 }
00853 
00854 static int dcsc_ioctl(struct inode* inode, struct file* filp, unsigned int cmd, unsigned long arg)
00855 {
00856   int iResult=0;
00857   if (filp==NULL || inode==NULL) {
00858     mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "ioctl: invalid file/inode pointer");
00859     return -EFAULT;
00860   }
00861   if (cmd>=IOCTL_READ_REG && cmd<IOCTL_READ_REG+dcsc_regfile_size) {
00862     int iReg=cmd-IOCTL_READ_REG;
00863     iResult=*(((char*)regfile_virtbase)+iReg);
00864     mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_DBG, KERN_INFO "ioctl: read register %d = %#x", iReg, iResult);
00865   } else if (cmd>=IOCTL_WRITE_REG && cmd<IOCTL_WRITE_REG+dcsc_regfile_size) {
00866     int iReg=cmd-IOCTL_READ_REG;
00867     if (arg>=256) {
00868       mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_INFO, MR_KERN_DEBUG "ioctl: attempt to write register %d with argument larger than one byte, msbs will be ignored", iReg);
00869       arg&=0xff;
00870     }
00871     *(((char*)regfile_virtbase)+iReg)=arg;
00872   } else switch (cmd) {
00873   case IOCTL_GET_MSGBUF_IN_SIZE:
00874     *((u32*)arg)=dcsc_msgbuf_in_size;
00875     iResult=dcsc_msgbuf_in_size;
00876     break;
00877   case IOCTL_GET_MSGBUF_OUT_SIZE:
00878     *((u32*)arg)=dcsc_msgbuf_out_size;
00879     iResult=dcsc_msgbuf_out_size;
00880     break;
00881   case IOCTL_GET_REGFILE_SIZE:
00882     *((u32*)arg)=dcsc_regfile_size;
00883     iResult=dcsc_regfile_size;
00884     break;
00885   case IOCTL_GET_VERSION_V02:
00886   case IOCTL_GET_VERSION:
00887     {
00888       if (arg!=0) {
00889     char versionstring[VERSION_STRING_SIZE];
00890     int iLen=snprintf(versionstring, sizeof(versionstring), "%d.%d - %s", DRIVER_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER, DRIVER_MINOR_VERSION_NUMBER, RELEASETYPE);
00891     if (iLen>0) {
00892       copy_to_user((void*)arg, versionstring, iLen);
00893     } else {
00894       copy_to_user((void*)arg, "", 1);
00895     }
00896       }
00897       iResult=(DRIVER_MAJOR_VERSION_NUMBER << 16) + DRIVER_MINOR_VERSION_NUMBER;
00898     }
00899     break;
00900   case IOCTL_GET_VERS_STR_SIZE:
00901     iResult=VERSION_STRING_SIZE;
00902     break;
00903   case IOCTL_SET_DEBUG_LEVEL:
00904     if (arg>0xffff)
00905       mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_WARNING, KERN_WARNING "ioctl: log flags are 16 bit wide, skip MSBs of argument");
00906     arg&=0xffff;
00907     g_logflags=arg;
00908     break;
00909   case IOCTL_SET_LOG_FILE:
00910     if (arg>0) {
00911       if (strlen((char*)arg)<sizeof(g_logfilename)-1) {
00912     sprintf(g_logfilename, (char*)arg);
00913     mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "ioctl (0x%x): set logfile name to \'%s\'", cmd, g_logfilename);
00914       } else {
00915     mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "iotcl (0x%x): file name to long, maximum name length %d", cmd, sizeof(g_logfilename));
00916     iResult=-EINVAL;
00917       }
00918     } else {
00919       mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_ERROR, KERN_ERR "iotcl (0x%x): invalid argument", cmd);
00920       iResult=-EINVAL;
00921     }
00922     break;
00923   case IOCTL_LOCK_DRIVER:
00924     iResult=lockDriver(arg, 0);
00925     break;
00926   case IOCTL_UNLOCK_DRIVER:
00927     iResult=unlockDriver(arg);
00928     break;
00929   case IOCTL_SEIZE_DRIVER:
00930     iResult=seizeDriver(arg);
00931     break;
00932   case IOCTL_RELEASE_DRIVER:
00933     iResult=releaseDriver(arg);
00934     break;
00935   case IOCTL_RESET_LOCK:
00936     iResult=lockReset();
00937     break;
00938   case IOCTL_ACTIVATE_LOCK:
00939     iResult=lockActivate();
00940     break;
00941   case IOCTL_TEST_MSGBUF_IN:
00942   case IOCTL_TEST_MSGBUF_OUT:
00943     mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_INFO, KERN_INFO "ioctl: command not implemented");
00944     iResult=-ENOSYS;
00945     break;
00946   default:
00947     mrlogmessage(LOG_IOCTL|LOG_DBG, MR_KERN_DEBUG "ioctl: unknown command 0x%x", cmd);
00948   }
00949   return iResult;
00950 }
